qas.question: Who was Norfolk Island colonised by?
What purpose did Norfolk Island serve for the majority of the time from 1788 until 1855?
What date did civilians begin to permanently reside in Norfolk Island?
Where did the first permanent civilians of Norfolk Island settle from in 1856?
In what year did the UK hand Norfolk Island over to Australia to administrate?
Who was Norfolk Island destroyed by?
What purpose did Norfolk Island avoid for the majority of the time from 1788 until 1855?
What date did civilians begin to permanently leave Norfolk Island?
Where were the first permanent civilians of Norfolk Island banned from in 1856?
What year did the UK hand Norfolk Island over to America to administrate?

context: Norfolk Island was colonised by <a0_0><b5_0>East Polynesians<b5_0/><a0_0/> but was long unpeopled when it was settled by Great Britain as part of its settlement of Australia from 1788. The island served as <a1_0><b6_0>a convict penal settlement<b6_0/><a1_0/> from 6 March 1788 until 5 May 1855, except for an 11-year hiatus between 15 February 1814 and 6 June 1825, when it lay abandoned. On <a2_0><b7_0>8 June 1856<b7_0/><a2_0/>, permanent civilian residence on the island began when it was settled from <a3_0><b8_0>Pitcairn Island<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In <a4_0><b9_0>1913<b9_0/><a4_0/>, the UK handed Norfolk over to Australia to administer as an external territory.
